p: Symptoms of COVID-19 include sneezing, cough, sore throat, fever, headache and feeling of being unwell [ 3, 7], which may appear in a few as 2 days, or as long as 14 days, after exposure to the virus [ 3, 7]. Lower-respiratory tract ailments, such as pneumonia or bronchitis, may sometimes be caused by human coronaviruses. COVID-19 symptoms are often mild, with ≈ 20% of infections progressing to severe diseases, such as pneumonia, respiratory failure and, in some cases, death [ 8].
